On 20/12/2007, krn_2k <krn_2k@...> wrote:

> Patches against specific versions can be posted anywhere Sourceforge
> message forums etc so no need to open up write access to everybody.
> Even if you did open write access up to many people as most popular OS
> projects do, you can always use "blame" mode of SVN to see who did
> what and when, and roll back mistakes easily - so it is _very_
> difficult for chaos to rein :)

Actualy I'm not sure it's even an option to open a sourceforge SVN
repository to everyone. So it would probably always be limited to
developers that have explicitly been added to the project.

> As for major branching modifications like Hyper/Parralel neat it is a
> simple matter to create a branch in a SVN repository and hand out
> branch write access to whoever you choose.

OK - I wonder if I can alter access per branch on sourceforge?


> The advantage for everyone
> of this is that any bug fixes, upgrades and improvements to common
> code on any branch or in the main release can easily be merged across
> or patches created (by anyone not just code maintainers) so all
> flavors of SharpNeat can benefit from the hard work...


Well it's there now so if anyone wants their own branch to work on let me know.


Colin.
